My group ran into something similar recently -- some people had built
their=
 code with JBuilder, and others had built with ant and the standard
JDK.  W=
e got odd errors when we tried to run code together that had been
compiled =
differently.  Apparently, JBuilder uses its own internal JDK
which is not 1=
00% the same as the standard.  It would not surprise me if
VisualCafe did s=
omething similar.
 
Your best bet is probably to standardize on one or the =
other - either
compile and run everything from inside of Visual Cafe, or us=
e it only as
your editor and instead use ant (or make, or whatever) to buil=
d and run.

-----Original Message-----
From: David Roussel [mailto:dir@bjss=
.co.uk]
Sent: Wednesday, September 05, 2001 6:28 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.c=
om
Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message



Sorry Pank I don't know t=
he solution to you problem.  However I used to
use VisualCafe 4 and now I h=
ave moved to Ant, Jikes and a text editor I
suffer less stress.
 
-----Orig=
inal Message-----
From: Pankaj Solanki [mailto:psolanki@...]
Sent: 05 S=
eptember 2001 14:18
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] JUnit3.7 Err=
or message



Hi all,
 
Will any of you plz assess, why my SimpleTest.java =
file is failing :
  
The problem I am facing is:
 
When I compile a junit t=
est file thru' VisualCafe4.0, it gets compiled
without any error.
Later whi=
le invoking the TestRunner utility from console (any approach -
textui, awt=
ui or swingui),
I am getting following error message:
 
java.lang.Incompati=
bleClassChangeError: junit.framework.Assert: method
assert(Ljava/lang/Strin=
g;Z)V did not used to be static
 
 at junit.samples.SimpleTest.testAdd(Simp=
leTest.java:32)
 
But surprisingly if I compile the same file from console =
and run the
TestRunner utility then test passes without any error and it sh=
ow a
green bar. Perfect run.
 
My VisualCafe4.0 setting is fine (junit.jar =
and the directory which
contain this jar file is included in the classpath =
of sc.ini file). 
 
Thanks,
 
Pankaj
